segments.text: I can't believe the sink is overflowing like that, water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, polishing that plate as if nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron and dress are going to get soaked soon, and she doesn't even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That puddle on the floor is spreading, and it's going to ruin the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now look at those kids, climbing on that unstable stool like it's a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into the cookie jar, breaking all the rules.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is egging him on, holding out her hand for stolen cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tilting backward; they're going to fall and hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a nice garden, but inside it's chaos she ignores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes are stacked everywhere, just waiting to be knocked over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is frustrating; someone needs to step in now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so oblivious to the mess behind her?
segments.speaker: PAR
